shapes3d

Class Cone

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.Shape3D
      • shapes3d.Cone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants, SConstants

    public class Cone
extends Shape3D
    A 3D cone shape.
    The centre of rotation is the centre of the flat end (base) and the cone point in the y [0,1,0] direction.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cone

        public Cone(PApplet app,
    int nbrSegments)
        Create a cone shape.
        The shape is recalculated so the [0,1,0] axis is now 'up'
        The shape's coordinates are translated to make 'centreOfRot' the objects centre of rotation.
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet to draw this shape
        nbrSegments - number of segments (pizza slices)

      • Cone

        public Cone(PApplet app,

      • drawMode

        public void drawMode(int mode)
        Sets the draw mode for the cone part.
        The three constants Shape3D.SOILD, Shape3D.WIRE and Shape3D.TEXTURE are used to determine how the shape is drawn. These can be ored together to get different drawing combinations e.g. Shape3D.SOLID | Shape3D.WIRE would be a coloured shape with edges. If the parameter is Shape3D.TEXTURE then and a texture has not been set then it will use SOLID.
        Overrides:
        drawMode in class Shape3D
        Parameters:
        mode -

      • drawMode

        public void drawMode(int mode,
            int sides)
        Sets the colour to be used for TOP, BASE or ALL depending on second parameter.
        Overrides:
